subject: Yes ' 50 Ways to be Persuasive Checklist
credit: Yes ' 50 Ways to be Persuasive Checklist

todos.title: Training
todos.body: Studying error of the past, reading debriefs.

todos.title: Influence
todos.body: Reciprocity, authority, commitment, scarcity, liking, social proof, mystery.

todos.title: Rhymes
todos.body: Help sell.

todos.title: Distractions
todos.body: You're more likely to believe what you read if you are distracted.

todos.title: Handwriting
todos.body: The worse the handwriting the less persuasive the message will be.

todos.title: Not What Say, What they Hear
todos.body: The toughest job you'll ever love.  Our rooms aren't fancy, but our prices aren't fancy.  We're more expensive but your worth it.  Be honest, expose your vulnerabilities, and people will trust you.

todos.title: Piggybacking
todos.body: State value of the item you are giving for free if they sign up.

todos.title: Inconvenience Your Buyer
todos.body: Say things like if operators are busy please wait, please RSVP, we will do all we can to get you in, it is very competitive.

todos.title: Sadness
todos.body: Sad buyers were willing to purchase a product for 30% more.

todos.title: Ambiguous Names
todos.body: Products with ambiguous names are more desirable.  Creates a sense of mystery.

todos.title: Scarcity
todos.body: Point out what features of your product are rare.

todos.title: Subliminal Placement
todos.body: Place something subliminal in front of client that stresses the importance of what you do.

todos.title: Consistency
todos.body: People's preference for consistency becomes greatly strengthened as they get older.

todos.title: Magnetic Middle
todos.body: People who deviate from average tend to be drawn to average.

todos.title: Options
todos.body: People usually chose the cheaper option if two are presented and the middle option if three are presented.

todos.title: Ask Favors
todos.body: People that have once done you kindness will likely continue to do so.

todos.title: Tired
todos.body: People that are tired are more willing to give in to a negotiation or purchase.

todos.title: Oppenheimer Naming Rule
todos.body: People have a greater affection for words and names that are easier to pronounce.

todos.title: Loss Aversion
todos.body: People are more motivated to avoid loss than to acquire gains.  Frame everything as what they have to lose.

todos.title: Favors
todos.body: Over time the receiver devalues the favor thinking that it wasn't much value and the giver increases the value of the gift thinking that they really went out of their way.  Don't wait too long to have someone return your favors.

todos.title: Damaging Effect
todos.body: Offering people too much causes them to devalue the products.  Limit and romanticizes the options.

todos.title: Fear Mongering
todos.body: Motivates and stimulates.  Give the specific threat with a clear, specific, easy to follow plan.

todos.title: Because
todos.body: Most important word in sales.  Give a reason for everything, people don't care the reason as long as they know why.  People don't like being in the dark.

todos.title: Communication
todos.body: Miscommunication is more prevalent over e-mail than phone or face to face.

todos.title: Mirroring
todos.body: Match customers verbalizations, dress, speech, tone, rate, pitch, etc.

todos.title: Labeling Technique
todos.body: Giving a person confidence by telling them that they are good at doing something.  By receiving this confidence they are likely to put more effort into that thing.  People seek others input on what they are good at and spend extra time on that.  Tell clients they are really good at keeping data and being strategic and tell them examples in the past when they have done so.  They will commit to this confirmation.

todos.title: Gifts of Significance
todos.body: Gifts should be significant (not out of protocol), unexpected and personalized.

todos.title: Ambassadors
todos.body: Get people to speak on your behalf.  Pay other to tout your company.  Have your employees boast about your other employees.

todos.title: Avoid Negative
todos.body: Don't try to influence by guilting people's conscience.

todos.title: Ask Them to Predict/Commit
todos.body: Do you think that someday you will be better at being data informed?  Commitments that are written are twice as powerful.  Get team members to write down their goals.

todos.title: Small Steps
todos.body: Do small things to get your foot in the door.  Get them into patterns of saying yes.

todos.title: Social Proof
todos.body: Display your diplomas, certificates, and awards.

todos.title: Ask Name
todos.body: Deters theft.

todos.title: Repeat
todos.body: Customers order to them exactly how they phrased it.

todos.title: Vulnerabilities
todos.body: Confess little faults so people see you don't have big ones.

todos.title: Last Leg
todos.body: Closer someone gets to a goal, the more effort they will exert.  Keep goals short.  Tell people they are almost there.
